verses.text: 治好病了三十八年的人這些事以後，到了猶太人的一個節期，耶穌就上耶路撒冷去。

words.note: Refers to people from Judea or of Jewish ethnicity.
Often refers to religious festivals like Passover.

verses.text: 在耶路撒冷靠近羊門有一個水池，希伯來話叫作畢士大，池邊有五處走廊。

words.note: A specific gate in the walls of Jerusalem.
Refers to the ancient Hebrew language.
Meaning 'house of mercy' or 'house of grace' in Hebrew.
Covered walkway supported by columns.

verses.text: 在那裡躺著許多病人，有瞎眼的、瘸腿的和癱瘓的。
（有些抄本有以下一段：「他們等候水動，4因為有主的使者按時下去攪動池水，水動之後，誰先下去，無論甚麼病，必得痊愈。」）
那裡有一個人，病了三十八年。
耶穌看見他躺著，知道他病了很久，就問他：「你要痊愈嗎？」

words.note: Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Often used in medical or religious contexts for full recovery.

verses.text: 病人回答：「先生，水動的時候，沒有人把我放在池裡；自己想去的時候，總是給別人搶先。」

words.note: Connects an attribute to a noun, or forms a nominalized phrase.
Marks the direct object, indicating it is acted upon.
Connects an attribute to a noun, or forms a nominalized phrase.
Indicates the agent in a passive construction.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「起來，拿著你的褥子走吧。」

words.note: Indicates suggestion or mild command.

verses.text: 那人立刻痊愈，就拿起褥子走了。那天正是安息日。

words.note: Often used in medical or religious contexts for full recovery.
Indicates completion of an action.
Lit. 'rest day', the day of rest in Judaism and Christianity.

verses.text: 因此猶太人對那醫好了的人說：「今天是安息日，你拿著褥子是不可以的。」

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
Connects an attribute to a noun.
Lit. 'rest day', the day of rest in Judaism and Christianity.

breakdown.m: by means of, used to; implies permission

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase or emphasizes a statement.

verses.text: 他卻回答：「那使我痊愈的對我說：『拿起你的褥子走吧』。」
他們就問：「那對你說『拿起來走吧』的是誰？」
那醫好了的人不知道他是誰，因為那裡人很多，耶穌已經避開了。
後來，耶穌在殿裡遇見那人，對他說：「你已經痊愈了，不可再犯罪，免得招來更大的禍患。」

words.note: Refers specifically to the Jerusalem Temple.

verses.text: 那人就去告訴猶太人，使他痊愈的就是耶穌。

words.note: Lit. 'Judah people'; '猶太' is a transliteration of 'Judah'.

verses.text: 從此猶太人就迫害耶穌，因為他常常在安息日作這些事。

words.note: Lit. 'peace and rest day'

verses.text: 耶穌卻對他們說：「我父作工直到現在，我也作工。」

words.note: Referring to God the Father.

verses.text: 因此猶太人就更想殺耶穌，因為他不但破壞安息日，而且稱 神為自己的父，把自己與 神當作平等。

words.note: is an honorific spacing.
Referring to God the Father.
is an honorific spacing.

verses.text: 人子的權柄耶穌又對他們說：「我實實在在告訴你們，子靠著自己不能作甚麼，只能作他看見父所作的；因為父所作的事，子也照樣作。

words.note: Emphatic doubling, common in biblical texts.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.
Often means 'anything' in negative contexts.
Referring to God the Father.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.
Referring to God the Father.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.

verses.text: 父愛子，把自己所作的一切指示給他看，還要把比這些更大的事指示給他看，使你們驚奇。

words.note: Referring to God the Father.
Referring to Jesus as the Son of God.

verses.text: 父怎樣叫死人復活，使他們得生命，子也照樣隨自己的意思使人得生命。

words.note: Refers to those who are spiritually or physically dead.
Often refers to spiritual life in the Bible.

verses.text: 父不審判人，卻已經把審判的權柄完全交給子，

words.note: Indicates that the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 使所有的人尊敬子好像尊敬父一樣。不尊敬子的，就是不尊敬那差他來的父。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause, meaning 'those who do not honor the Son'.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，那聽見我的話又信那差我來的，就有永生，不被定罪，而是已經出死入生了。

words.note: Emphatic reduplication, common in Jesus' teachings.
Often refers to God's word or Jesus' teachings.
A core concept in Christian faith.
Life that is unending and spiritual.
An idiomatic expression describing spiritual transformation.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，時候將到，現在就是了，死人要聽見 神兒子的聲音，聽見的人就要活了。

words.note: Emphatic reduplication, common in Jesus' teachings.
Refers to those who are spiritually or physically dead.
Often capitalized in Chinese Bibles to denote the one true God.
Here specifically refers to Jesus, the Son of God.
Forms a noun phrase meaning 'those who hear'.

verses.text: 就如父是生命的源頭，照樣他也使子成為生命的源頭，
並且把執行審判的權柄賜給他，因為他是人子。

words.note: A title for Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 你們不要把這事看作希奇，因為時候將到，那時所有在墳墓裡的都要聽見他的聲音，

words.definition: to regard as, to view as

words.note: Often means 'to marvel at' in biblical context.

verses.text: 並且都要出來；行善的復活得生命，作惡的復活被定罪。

words.note: Lit. 'to practice good'.
Lit. 'to commit evil'.

verses.text: 給耶穌作見證的「我靠著自己不能作甚麼，我怎樣聽見，就怎樣審判。我的審判是公義的，因為我不尋求自己的意思，只求那差我來者的旨意。

words.note: A common V-O compound in biblical contexts.
Often used in 'If... then...' or 'as soon as... then...' constructions.
Here '來' refers to the one who caused Jesus to come, i.e., God.
Refers to God's will or purpose.

verses.text: 我若為自己作證，我的見證就不真。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to do/make a testimony'.
Lit. 'seen evidence'.

verses.text: 然而另有一位為我作證的，我知道他為我作的見證是真的。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase: 'the one who testifies for me'.
Indicates certainty or emphasis.

verses.text: 你們曾經派人到約翰那裡，他為真理作過見證。

words.note: Verb followed by aspect particle indicating past experience.

verses.text: 我不接受從人而來的見證，但我說這些事，是要你們得救。

words.note: Literally 'and come', implying 'to come from'.

verses.text: 約翰是一盞點亮的燈，你們情願暫時在他的光中歡樂。

words.note: Verb-complement structure meaning 'to light until bright'.
Used as a postposition indicating 'within' or 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 但我有比約翰更大的見證，因為父賜給我要我完成的工作，就是我所要作的，證明我是父所差來的。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Refers to God the Father.
Verb-complement compound meaning 'to send here'.

verses.text: 差我來的父親自為我作了見證。他的聲音，你們從沒有聽過；他的容貌，你們從沒有見過；

words.note: Verb-complement compound meaning 'to send here'.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 他的道，你們也不放在心裡，因為你們不信他所差來的那一位。

words.note: Often refers to God's word or teaching in biblical context.
Verb-complement compound meaning 'to send here'.

verses.text: 你們研究聖經，因為你們認為聖經中有永生，其實為我作證的就是這聖經，

words.note: Refers to the Christian Bible.
Refers to the Christian Bible.
Refers to the Christian Bible.

verses.text: 然而你們卻不肯到我這裡來得生命。
「我不接受從人而來的稱讚；

words.note: Often used to indicate origin or source.

verses.text: 我知道你們心裡沒有 神的愛。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 我奉我父的名而來，你們不接待我；如果有別人以自己的名義而來，你們倒接待他。

words.definition: in the name of, to obey
words.note: In biblical context, often 'in the name of' or 'by command'.
In this context, refers to God the Father.

words.definition: in the name of, under the guise of

verses.text: 你們彼此接受稱讚，卻不尋求從獨一的 神而來的稱讚，怎麼能信呢？

words.note: Often used in biblical context for 'the one and only God'.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 不要以為我要向父控告你們，有一位控告你們的，就是你們所仰賴的摩西。

words.note: In this context, refers to God the Father.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding verb/phrase.
Used before verbs to form a passive or nominalized structure.

words.definition: to rely on, to depend on

verses.text: 你們若信摩西，也必信我，因為他所寫的書曾論及我。

words.note: Used to indicate the object of a verb or nominalize a verb phrase.
Used here to form a nominalized phrase 'that which was written'.
More formal than everyday 'mention'.

verses.text: 你們若不信他所寫的，怎能信我的話呢？」

words.note: Used to indicate the object of a verb or nominalize a verb phrase.
Used here to form a nominalized phrase 'that which he wrote'.
Expresses a rhetorical or suggestive question.
